thread.title: 49ers defensive star, ex-'Bachelor' contestant expecting baby boy
thread.title_full: 49ers defensive star, ex-'Bachelor' contestant expecting baby boy

author: Katie Dowd
title: 49ers defensive star, ex-'Bachelor' contestant expecting baby boy
text:
San Francisco 49ers defensive star
Fred Warner and one-time reality dating show contestant Sydney Hightower Warner announced this week that they're expecting a baby boy.
Sydney, who grew up in Alabama, was cast on pilot Peter Weber's season of "The Bachelor" that aired in early 2020. Although she was eliminated in week six, the show still led to love for the then-retail marketing manager: Sydney said Warner hit her up on social media. “He actually sent me an emoji [because] he didn’t think I was gonna respond and that’s why he got really casual," she told
US Weekly, "but it was sweet."
The pair began dating and got engaged in May 2021 —
complete with a red rose a la "The Bachelor." The Warners married about a year later in Vista, San Diego County. This is their first child together.
Advertisement
Article continues below this ad
On Tuesday, the pair announced they're having a boy with an adorable video posted to Instagram. "Can I look at it first?" Sydney asks nervously as they wait to click on the news, presumably from their health care provider. "Stop, let's go," Fred says. Then, spoiler for your ears, Fred lets out a joyful scream as they learn they're having a boy.
It's a busy time for the Warner family. On Sunday, the 49ers end the regular season at home against the Rams. Then, they're set for a first-round bye week after
wrapping up the NFC's top seed last week. Baby Warner is due in March.
